newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH SHELL CUTS UNLEADED PETROL PRICES.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH SHELL CUTS UNLEADED PETROL PRICES.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell unit Shell Nederland BV said on Friday it would reduce its retail prices for unleaded petrol by 0.01 guilders per litre with effect from Monday.
The move reflected changes in international product prices and the value of the dollar against the guilder, Shell said.

From Monday the recommended price for unleaded Euro petrol will be reduced to 2.01 guilders per litre from 2.02. Super Plus unleaded will retail at 2.06 guilders/litre from 2.07, while Super with lead substitute will sell for 2.12 guilders/litre.
Gasoline prices will remain unchanged, it added.
